intro: Encephalartos latifrons, commonly known as the broad-leaved cycad, is a member of the Zamiaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is characterized by its large, pinnately compound leaves that can reach up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces a tall, cylindrical stem that bears a single, large, spherical cone. Encephalartos latifrons is a slow-growing, long-lived species that thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and conservation status, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
